macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Markets Plunge on Greenland Tariff Threats
items.summary: Major US equity indices fell sharply on January 21, 2026, with the Nasdaq dropping 2.39% to 22,954, the S&P 500 falling 2.06% to 6,796, and the Dow declining 1.76% to 48,488. Over 70% of US stocks declined as investors reacted to President Trump's tariff threats related to Greenland.

items.title: Global Risk-Off Trading Spreads to Asia-Pacific Markets
items.summary: Japan and Hong Kong equity markets ended lower amid broader risk-off sentiment, with SoftBank slipping 3.3% and Tokyo Electron falling 2.6% as higher yields weighed on technology stocks. The Hang Seng eased 0.3% to 26,488.

items.title: Volatility Spikes Above 20 as Market Stress Signals Elevate
items.summary: The VIX surged above 20 as investors adopted defensive positioning. Short-dated stress signals remain elevated, with near-term volatility rising faster than longer-dated measures, indicating continued sensitivity to policy headlines.

items.title: Gold Hits Record High Amid Safe-Haven Demand
items.summary: Gold rallied 1.98% to a fresh record high of $4,763.43 per ounce as investors sought safety. Brent crude rose 1.53% to $64.92 and WTI crude gained 1.51% to $60.34 amid renewed tariff concerns.

items.title: US Dollar Weakens on US-Europe Confrontation
items.summary: The US dollar came under significant pressure as the 'sell America' trade gathered momentum, with the DXY falling 0.83% to 98.57. Treasury yields rose despite dollar weakness, reflecting diverging market dynamics.

items.title: Major Earnings Reports Expected: Johnson & Johnson, Charles Schwab, Prologis
items.summary: Key Q4 earnings reports are scheduled, with health care giant Johnson & Johnson, brokerage Charles Schwab, and REIT Prologis among major companies reporting. Regional banks are also reporting in premarket and aftermarket sessions.

items.title: Supreme Court Tariff Decision and Davos Summit Await Market Attention
items.summary: Investors are awaiting the Supreme Court's decision on Trump's tariffs and developments from the Davos summit in Switzerland, where US leaders and ECB President Christine Lagarde are expected to speak.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Trades Between $87,896 and $91,443 as Market Cap Drops 2.24% to $3.07T
items.summary: Bitcoin fluctuated between $87,896 and $91,443 over the past 24 hours, currently at $89,409 down 1.80%, while the global crypto market cap fell 2.24% to $3.07T. Major coins like ETH (-4.11%) and BNB (-4.31%) also declined amid mixed trading.

items.title: Crypto Selloff Continues: Bitcoin Below $89K, Ethereum at $2,920, XRP Seventh Down Day
items.summary: The market extended losses with Bitcoin dropping to $88,626 (-9.6% from Jan 17 peak), Ethereum to $2,920, and XRP at $1.89 after seven straight declines. Analysts attribute the fall to macro risk-off moves and technical weakness.

items.title: Dogecoin Falls for Eighth Straight Day to $0.1254 Amid Broader Market Decline
items.summary: Dogecoin dropped 0.7% on Wednesday to $0.1254, marking its eighth consecutive decline with only one green session since January 6. Technicals point to potential further drops to $0.12065 or lower if support breaks.

items.title: Bitcoin Bears in Control per Daily Chart Analysis
items.summary: February bitcoin futures held steady after Tuesday losses, with technical analyst Jim Wyckoff noting bears firmly in control on the daily chart. This reflects ongoing downward pressure in early Wednesday trading.

items.title: U.S. Treasury to Include Seized Bitcoin in Digital Asset Reserves
items.summary: The U.S. Treasury plans to incorporate seized Bitcoin into digital asset reserves, marking a significant policy shift. This development highlights growing institutional integration of cryptocurrencies.

items.title: Delaware Life Insurance Integrates Bitcoin Index into Annuity Products
items.summary: Delaware Life Insurance has added a Bitcoin index to its annuity products, providing retail investors exposure to BTC through traditional insurance. This move signals mainstream adoption in financial products.

items.title: Memecoin Trading Volume Spikes to $5.6B Before Cooling
items.summary: Memecoin trading volume briefly hit $5.6B amid profit-taking, with analysts noting cooling momentum. This surge reflects speculative activity despite broader market downturn.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: NETL Launches ClaiMM, First Digital Platform for CMM Community
items.summary: The National Energy Technology Laboratory has launched ClaiMM, a digital collaboration platform integrating advanced AI and machine learning for the CMM (Carbon Management and Measurement) community.

items.title: Human Brain Processes Language Similarly to Advanced AI Models
items.summary: Researchers from Hebrew University, Google Research, and Princeton University discovered that the human brain understands spoken language through a stepwise process that closely mirrors how AI language models like GPT operate, with brain activity patterns matching AI layer structures.

items.title: AI Models Surpass Average Human Creativity in Large-Scale Study
items.summary: A study led by Université de Montréal researchers comparing 100,000 humans with leading generative AI models found that some AI systems like GPT-4 now exceed average human creativity, though the most creative individuals still outperform all AI systems.

items.title: AI-Enabled Approaches Transform Lung Disease Diagnosis and Management
items.summary: Healthcare institutions are deploying AI models for lung disease diagnosis, including systems like Mayo's Asthma Guidance and Prediction System (A-GPS), which reduces clinical decision-making time by 70% and identifies at-risk patients as young as 3 years old.

items.title: Siwei Lyu Named Director of University at Buffalo's AI Institute
items.summary: Deepfake forensics expert Siwei Lyu has been appointed director of UB's Institute for Artificial Intelligence and Data Science, leading over 500 AI-infused projects across the university's 200+ faculty members.

items.title: Machine Learning Accelerates Small-Molecule Drug Discovery
items.summary: Recent advances combining tandem mass spectrometry, high-throughput screening, and machine learning are enabling rapid identification of novel compounds, with AI-driven interpretation now predicting molecular structures in milliseconds.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Xbox Developer Direct Showcase Set for January 22 with Beast of Reincarnation, Forza Horizon 6, and Fable
items.summary: Xbox's fourth Developer Direct showcase is scheduled for January 22, featuring Game Freak's Beast of Reincarnation, Forza Horizon 6, and Fable from Playground Games, with expectations for surprise announcements.

items.title: World of Warcraft Midnight Pre-Expansion Patch Goes Live
items.summary: Blizzard released the pre-expansion patch for WoW Midnight, introducing new features including a Demon Hunter Devourer specialization, Void Elf Demon Hunters, UI updates, PvP Training Grounds, and housing systems.

items.title: Netflix Prioritizes Cloud-Based TV Games in 2026
items.summary: Netflix co-CEO Greg Peters announced that the streamer's video game division will focus on bringing cloud-based titles to television screens as a major priority for 2026.

items.title: New York Times Launches First Multiplayer Game, Expands Gaming Portfolio
items.summary: The New York Times released its first 2-player game as part of its expanding games division, which includes the popular Wordle (played 4.2 billion times last year) and other human-crafted puzzle games.

items.title: Mobile Apps Surpass Games in Consumer Spending for First Time, Driven by AI Adoption
items.summary: In 2025, consumers spent more on mobile apps than games, with AI app publishers like OpenAI and DeepSeek accounting for nearly 50% of global downloads, up from 21% in 2024.

items.title: Hytale Reveals End-Game Ore Mithril Mining Mechanics
items.summary: Hytale developers announced details about the game's elusive end-game ore, mithril, which will have more complex mining mechanics compared to other ores in the game.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
